item.title: All Highguard Currencies—How Many Are There, How To Earn & How They Work
item.content:encoded:
It’s a common trend in multiplayer games to have numerous currencies, and Highguard appears to be no different. As soon as you load into the game, you’ll see a selection of small symbols at the top right of your screen, indicating how much of each currency you own.

The thing is, when you’re loading into a new game like Highguard for the first time, the whole experience can be overwhelming, and the last thing you want to figure out is which currencies can be spent where, let alone how to earn them!

Luckily for you, Insider Gaming has you covered, as in this guide, you’ll find out everything you need to know about Highguard’s various currencies.

How Many Currencies Are In Highguard?

There are three currencies in Highguard, and each one has its own unique purpose.

The currencies in question are as follows:

  • Highguard Gold
  • Warden Credits
  • Vigil Tokens

As is often the case, these currencies have their own rules: each one can only be spent in certain ways, they cannot be interchanged between one another, and they’re all earned in their own unique way.

But don’t worry, there’s no need for confusion, as Insider Gaming have broken down each currency for your convenience.

Highguard Gold, Explained

Highguard Gold is the premium currency of Highguard. It is used to purchase War Chests and Store Cosmetics.

The main way to earn Highguard Gold is through direct in-game microtransactions, with the prices shown above in GBP. As things stand, there are no other ways to earn the currency.

It’d be great to see it available through other means in the future, either via War Chests or perhaps even Ranked rewards, as plenty of other live-service games offer their premium currency as in-game rewards. Until then, though, if you see something you fancy in the store, you’re going to need to pull out the wallet.

Warden Credits, Explained

Warden Credits are used to purchase cosmetics from the Trading Post, an in-game store that rotates its stock weekly.

The Trading Post is similar to the Store, except it offers a smaller variety of cosmetics that can be earned without the need for microtransactions. That’s because Warden Credits can be earned in-game, either by completing challenges or simply playing games.

However, if you’re managing to accrue a lot of them, be warned, as Warden Credits are capped at 10,000. Once you hit this upper limit, you’ll stop storing them in the bank, so be sure to spend them!

Vigil Tokens, Explained

Finally, there’s Vigil Tokens. These are used to purchase items in War Chests, which are packed with various cosmetics.

The primary way to earn these Vigil Tokens is simply by playing matches. The more you play, the more you’ll earn, so it’s a great incentive to reward regular players with some high-tier cosmetic items.

Similar to the Warden Credits, though, there’s an upper limit to how many you can hold onto. 3,000 is the maximum amount of Vigil Tokens you can have at one time, so once again, be sure to spend them when you get them!

What do you think of Highguard so far? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Highguard, check out the complete trophy list, as well as its crossplay status, explained.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1683: Hints and Answer for January 27, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1683 for January 27, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, January 27, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1683 is challenging puzzle. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.8 of 6 guesses. That still makes it easier as the 5-guess average from January 23.

General Wordle Hints For January 27

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is most often used to describe lighting or atmosphere.
  • Hint 2: It commonly appears when talking about the end of the day.
  • Hint 3: The tone of the word leans more moody than bright.
  • Hint 4: You’ll often see it used in descriptive writing rather than technical contexts.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1683 for January 27, 2026.

Starter Words For January 27, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • CURLY
  • SANDY
  • DUSTY
  • MUSTKY

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1683 On January 27, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: DUSKY

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

DUSKY is an adjective that means “somewhat dark; having little light; dim; shadowy.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1682 on January 26, 2026

Answer: FREAK

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1683?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on January 28 will be Wordle Game #1684.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: All Highguard Launch Day Content—Maps, Content, Weapons & More
item.content:encoded:
Highguard is finally here, and after a long month of waiting and speculating, we finally know what the game is about. Not only do we know how the game plays, but we also know what it’s launching with, and it’s a whole lot of content.

For live-service games like Highguard intends to be, it’s important to keep content pouring in. However, if there isn’t enough to start with, then players won’t have anything to get hooked to.

It doesn’t seem like Highguard will have that issue, as there’s a wealth of content to explore at launch.

All Wardens & Mounts Available For Highguard Launch

There are eight Wardens to choose from, each with their own abilities and skills, as well as three different Mounts. More are scheduled to come with future content updates.

It looks like there’s a nice variety of Wardens to choose from in Highguard, with five playstyles seemingly catered for with their classes. There are three Assault and two Defensive Wardens, making them the most common class at launch.

The eight Wardens available at launch in Highguard are:

The three Mounts available at launch in Highguard are:

  • Horse
  • Panther
  • Bear

All Maps & Bases Available For Highguard Launch

There are five maps to play at launch for Highguard, with a roster of six Bases to select from each match.

Wildlight Entertainment describe the Maps and Bases very distinctly. The Maps are more open-world environments full of loot and gear to collect, whilst the Bases are smaller, typical FPS-style areas that offer more close-quarters combat. It looks set to offer diverse gameplay scenarios, and it’s notably different from other titles in the genre.

Here’s all five Maps available at launch in Highguard:

  • Dustline
  • Kingdom
  • Rivermark
  • Summit
  • Vesper City

All Weapons Available For Highguard Launch

Ten Primary Weapons are available at launch in Highguard, with three Raid Weapons up for selection too—and don’t forget your Melee Axe!

That makes a total of 14 weapons in Highguard, with plenty more bound to arrive across the year. It’s a simple but healthy selection that should hopefully see balancing not become an issue so early in the game’s lifecycle.

Here’s all 14 weapons available at launch in Highguard:

What have you made of Highguard’s launch? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Highguard, check out whether it has crossplay, as well as its various file sizes.

item.title: Highguard 2026 Roadmap—All Highguard Episode Content, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Developer Wildlight Entertainment went big with a year-long 2026 roadmap for Highguard. It features information on each episode and what to expect from every batch of new content: Each includes a new Warden and much more.

The time for talking is over as Highguard is out now. Geoff Keighley bigged it up as the second coming of Apex Legends and Titanfall, and it’s not bad at all. If you think Highguard’s base-raiding action is something that’ll keep you gripped for a while, then you need the full 2026 roadmap hub bookmarked for the good times ahead.

Highguard Episode 1 2026 Roadmap Content, Explained

Highguard Episode 1 is the launch-day content. You obviously need content to get a game going, and the gameplay showcase revealed the shooter’s first Wardens, maps, guns, and the rest of the glitz and glamour for opening day:

  • 5 Maps
  • 6 Bases
  • 8 Wardens
  • 3 Mounts
  • 10 Weapons
  • 3 Raid Tools

Highguard Episode 2 2026 Roadmap Content—February to March

Following up on the launch episode is Episode 2, and this one debuts a fresh Warden, map, and Ranked Mode. Here’s the full list of content announced:

  • New Warden
  • New Map
  • Ranked Mode
  • New Mount
  • New Base
  • New Raid Tool

Highguard Episode 3 2026 Roadmap Content—April to May

You’re going to see a familiar theme with a lot of this content as we go. The character selection screen will become more full, and the meta will be shaken up with a new weapon:

  • New Warden
  • New Weapon
  • New Mods
  • New Base
  • New Loot Item
  • New Amulets

Highguard Episode 4 2026 Roadmap Content—June to July

The biggest addition in Episode 4’s content (featuring the tropical months of the year!) is a new Limited-Time Mode. There aren’t many mentions of LTMs in the 2026 roadmap, so it’ll be interesting to see what the new mode is:

  • New Warden
  • New Map
  • New Weapon
  • New Mods
  • New Base
  • New Limited-Time Mode
  • New Amulets

Highguard Episode 5 2026 Roadmap Content—August to September

Episode 5 looks like a standard couple of months of new content. New additions to many of the Highguard’s core components await:

  • New Warden
  • New Weapon
  • New Mount
  • New Mods
  • New Base
  • New Loot Item
  • New Amulets

Highguard Episode 6 2026 Roadmap Content—October to November

We’re getting the word, ‘Surprise.’ Given that it falls during Episode 6 and the Halloween season, it’s reasonable to assume the community is getting special spooky surprises, events, and costume tie-ins. Will Highguard do crossovers? We’ll have to see, check out the haul:

  • New Warden
  • New Map
  • New Weapon
  • Surprise
  • New Mods
  • New Base
  • New Amulets

Highguard Episode 7 2026 Roadmap Content—December

Rounding off Highguard’s first year is a rather sparse Episode 7, but more details are sure to be revealed closer to the time. A Winter-themed event and content are expected, and it carries on the tradition of a new Warden every Episode:

  • New Warden
  • Surprise
  • New Mods

There’s always an element of unpredictability with a new live-service game. Highguard looks the part, but it remains to be seen if it can maintain its player base. Share your early impressions of the game and what you make of its content through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

You should also check out Highguard’s Crossplay status and file sizes on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC.

item.title: WWE 2K26 King of Kings Edition Cover Features Triple H
item.content:encoded:
Triple H is on the cover of the Deluxe Edition of WWE 2K26.

2K Games announced on Twitter that Paul “Triple H” Levesque would be featured on the cover of the Deluxe Edition, dubbed the “King of Kings Edition,” for the upcoming WWE 2K26 game.

A two-time WWE Hall of Famer, Triple H has appeared in every WWE video game since his debut in WWF In Your House, the 1996 title released for the original PlayStation, Sega Saturn, and PC.

Over the years, he has also been a frequent cover star, starting with WWF Attitude in 1999. Iconic games such as WWE SmackDown: Shut Your Mouth, WWE Day of Reckoning, and WWE SmackDown vs. Raw 2007 also feature “The Game” on the cover art. However, this cover is historic for the “King of Kings” because it marks the first time he has been featured solo.

This Is Not the Only Cover of WWE 2K26 Featuring Triple H

As announced on January 23, WWE 2K26 will also have a special Attitude Era edition. The cover art for that edition features many WWE legends from the late 1990s and early 2000s. Triple H was also on the cover. He was featured in the trailer alongside Shawn Michaels, Chyna, and the other members of D-Generation X.

WWE also announced a Monday Night War Edition of WWE 2K26. Triple H appears on the cover, representing WWE alongside Steve Austin, Undertaker, The Rock, Chyna, and Kurt Angle. He also appeared in the trailer for this edition, which focuses largely on the promotional rivalry between WWE and WCW that dominated the late ’90s and catapulted wrestling to a new level of popularity and success.

WWE 2K26 Will Bring Back Classic Match Types Familiar to Longtime Triple H Fans

As first reported by Insider Gaming, WWE 2K26 is expanding its gameplay offerings with four new playable match types. The game introduces the Dumpster Match for the first time while bringing back the Inferno Match, I Quit Match, and 3 Stages of Hell. Triple H has a history of competing in all three returning gimmick matches. Plus, The Island will make its return this year, featuring a completely new storyline.

As of now, 2K Games has not announced any specific DLC coming to this year’s game. However, on January 24, WWE confirmed that the Monday Night War Edition will provide access to the most content.

Pre-orders begin on January 30. However, there’s currently no set release date or price point. Recent WWE 2K games have released in March. Insider Gaming will keep you up-to-date with the latest WWE 2K26 news.

What do you think of the cover featuring Triple H? Which version, if any, of WWE 2K26 are you planning to pick up? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Highguard Receives “Mostly Negative” Reviews On Steam After Launch
item.content:encoded:
Highguard is out now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, and at least one segment of the gaming community has already left their impressions on the game. Within an hour of its release, Highguard has received “mostly negative” reviews on Steam from players.

From reported performance issues to players saying they’ve been booted from the game, there seems to be a number of concerns from players.

“Barely had 60 fps on a 5070 Ti & 14700K,” said one user.

Another added that they “logged in immediately and got kicked out of the game.” 

That said, while some of the concerns appear to be valid, there are many simply joining in on the belief of many that this will be a “Concord 2” situation. For what it’s worth, Concord peaked at just 697 players on Steam while Highguard has reached nearly 100,000 concurrent players as of writing.

And while the reviews are mostly negative in the early stages, there are plenty of positive reviews from players.

“The biggest takeaway after the first few matches is that the rules are really different,” one review reads. “This isn’t just a Temu Concord or [Overwatch]. The build-up, flag, and siege phases give the match a clear rhythm, and once you get used to it, it’s way more fun than pure aim duels.”

Another user said that nothing in the game felt “messy” despite the mixing of “a lot of gameplays”.

Have you had any success with Highuard so far? What are your initial thoughts? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more news, read about Ubisoft proposing up to 200 job cuts at its Paris headquarters. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…
